Search IPNI.

Source: R/ipni.R
search_ipni.Rd

Query the International Plant Names Index for nomenclatural information.

search_ipni(query, filters = NULL, page = 1, limit = 50)

Arguments

query

The string to query IPNI with.
filters

Filter to apply to search results. Can be one or more of families, genera, species, infrafamilies, infragenera, and infraspecies.
page

The page of records to return.
limit

The maximum number of records to return.

Value

Returns an object of class ipni_search that is a simple structure with slots for:

  • total: the total number of results held in POWO for the query

  • pages: the total number of results pages for the query.

  • limit: the maximum number of results requested from the API, per page.

  • results: the query results parsed into a list.

  • query: the query string submitted to the API.

  • response: the httr response object.

Details

The International Plant Names Index (IPNI) is a service that provides nomenclatural information for vascular plant names.

The search API allows users to query the database for plant names, as well as authors and publications. There may be limited support for some sort of fuzzy matching.

There is some support for querying using keyword arguments. Documentation for the API is currently available in the pykew package, so keywords have been copied across from there. There are sets of keywords relating to plants, authors, and publications.

The API will return nomenclatural information (publication date, nomenclatural status, author, etc.) of all names matching the query. These results can be limited, for example to only family names, using filters. See arguments for all implemented filters.

See also

  • lookup_ipni() to look up a name using an IPNI ID.

Other IPNI functions: lookup_ipni()

Examples

# search for all names containing Poa annua
results <- search_ipni("Poa annua")

# format search results in a table
format(results)

#> # A tibble: 13 x 44
#>    name  authors publishingAuthor authorTeam rank  url   family genus species
#>    <chr> <chr>   <chr>            <list>     <chr> <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>  
#>  1 Poa … L.      L.               <tibble [… spec. /n/3… Poace… Poa   annua  
#>  2 Poa … Steud.  Steud.           <tibble [… spec. /n/4… Poace… Poa   annua  
#>  3 Poa … Cham. … Cham. & Schltdl. <tibble [… spec. /n/4… Poace… Poa   annua  
#>  4 Poa … É.Desv. É.Desv.          <tibble [… var.  /n/2… Poace… Poa   annua  
#>  5 Poa … Wall. … Wall. ex Griseb. <tibble [… var.  /n/6… Poace… Poa   annua  
#>  6 Poa … Chrtek… Chrtek & V.Jirá… <tibble [… subs… /n/7… Poace… Poa   annua  
#>  7 Poa … Ronnig… Ronniger         <tibble [… var.  /n/7… Poace… Poa   annua  
#>  8 Poa … (Ronni… H.Scholz         <tibble [… subs… /n/7… Poace… Poa   annua  
#>  9 Poa … Mike L… Mike L.Grant     <tibble [… f.    /n/7… Poace… Poa   annua  
#> 10 Poa … (S.E.F… Chrtek           <tibble [… subs… /n/1… Poace… Poa   annua  
#> 11 Poa … S.E.Fr… S.E.Fröhner      <tibble [… var.  /n/5… Poace… Poa   annua  
#> 12 Poa … (Hauss… T.Koyama         <tibble [… f.    /n/9… Poace… Poa   annua  
#> 13 Poa … L.H.De… L.H.Dewey        <tibble [… var.  /n/2… Poace… Poa   annua  
#> # … with 35 more variables: citationType <chr>, hybrid <lgl>,

# extract author team information for the search results
results_tbl <- format(results)
tidyr::unnest(results_tbl, cols=c(authorTeam), names_sep="_")

# filter results to only species names
species_results <- search_ipni("Poa annua", filters="species")
format(species_results)

#> # A tibble: 3 x 34
#>   name  authors publishingAuthor authorTeam rank  url   family genus species
#>   <chr> <chr>   <chr>            <list>     <chr> <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>  
#> 1 Poa … L.      L.               <tibble [… spec. /n/3… Poace… Poa   annua  
#> 2 Poa … Steud.  Steud.           <tibble [… spec. /n/4… Poace… Poa   annua  
#> 3 Poa … Cham. … Cham. & Schltdl. <tibble [… spec. /n/4… Poace… Poa   annua  
#> # … with 25 more variables: citationType <chr>, hybrid <lgl>,

#> #   publication <chr>, publicationYear <int>, publicationYearNote <chr>,

#> #   reference <chr>, remarks <chr>, suppressed <lgl>, topCopy <lgl>,
#> #   typeLocations <chr>, version <chr>, id <chr>, fqId <chr>,
#> #   hasNomenclaturalNotes <lgl>, hasTypeData <lgl>, hasOriginalData <lgl>,
#> #   hasLinks <lgl>, bhlLink <chr>, pageAsText <chr>

# search for species from Mexico published in 1989
q <- list(published="1989", distribution="Mexico")
f <- "species"
results <- search_ipni(q, filters=f)
format(results)

#> # A tibble: 50 x 40

# search for an author by surname
author_results <- search_ipni(list(author_surname="Gardiner"))
format(author_results)
